marklogic.body: (self-indulgence alert) Yesterday I made the bellow comment long after the thread had gone Cold, but I want it out there. TT inferred that I was negative on our soldiers and that I attack them. I am very down on US military policy and I realize that this can lead to assumptions about the soldiers. Therefore, I want to be clear about how I feel about the men and women serving: ---- You're way Off about the soldiers, TT. As I've often said, what I feel most passionate about is how our soldiers were made victims by their superiors. They were shown the ultimate disrespect- they were asked to sacrifice under false pretenses. I feel compelled to support them by speaking out, as loudly as I can, against the system that has treated them like pawns - as if they were disposable and not real people with families - and by demanding that their torment end. I have great admiration for our soldiers and the near impossible task they've voluntarily accepted- I loath their betrayal. In the case of this particular atrocity (the murder of 16 civilians), I don't blame our service men and women in general nor even the one or many perpetrators. It's a matter of poor planning and unrealistic expectations. Their mission is unclear and often baffling- because it's based on a ruse. And we cannot expect a person to endure multiple and extended tours of duty under hellish conditions in a place where they can't tell ally from foe and emerge unscathed. The mental and physical toll on our soldiers is well documented- this (tragedy) is a consequence of mismanagement and dishonest policy.
